path: ./Audit_Reports_2024/HAECHI_AUDIT/[HAECHI LABS] TEMCO Smart Contract Audit Report v.2.0.pdf

findings.title: TemcoToken#mintTo() can burn tokens.
findings.description: Unintended behavior where TemcoToken#mintTo() function can burn tokens.

findings.title: Owner can mint limitlessly.
findings.description: The owner of the contract can execute the mint function regardless of the totalSupply, which goes against TEMCO's whitepaper stating a maximum token volume of 6,000,000,000.

findings.title: TemcoToken#mintTo() triggers an incorrect Event.
findings.description: _TemcoToken#mintTo()_ is a function that moves __value_ amount of tokens from __from_ to __to_. However, among the events triggered, there is one event in _Transfer_ that moves __value_ from address(0) to __to_. Considering most ethereum block explorers determine token transfers based on the _Transfer_ event, the ethereum block explorer might consider it an incorrect transfer of assets.

findings.title: In TemcoToken#transferFrom(), when _from is locked, sending fails but the transaction seems successful.
findings.description: Sending fails when _from is locked, but the transaction appears to be successful.
